title: sanger-tol/genomeassembly pipeline parameters
description: A bioinformatics best-practice analysis pipeline for genome assembly from PacBio CCS and HiC reads

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to YAML file containing information about the dataset
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

kmer_profiling_options.title: Kmer profiling options
kmer_profiling_options.description: Options for the kmer profiling subworkflow.

kmer_size.description: Kmer size to use for all kmer-based subroutines in the Kmer profiling subworkflow. This parameter is overridden by the provided kmer size for a given input read set if a FastK database is provided.

raw_assembly_options.title: Raw assembly options
raw_assembly_options.description: Options for tuning the outputs of raw assembies.

enable_hic_phasing.description: If Hi-C data is provided, enabling this will produce a Hi-C phased assembly with hifiasm.

enable_trio_binning.description: If parental read data is provided, enabling this will produce a trio binned assembly with hifiasm.

hifiasm_error_correction_options.help_text: See the "Error correction options" section of https://hifiasm.readthedocs.io/en/latest/parameter-reference.html for options.

hifiasm_assembly_options.description: Options controlling Hifiasm assembly output, including those affecting assemblty, purging, phasing and trio binning.

purging_assemblytypes.description: A comma-separated list defining which types of assemblies to purge. Must draw from the options "primary", "hic_phased", or "trio_binned".

purging_purge_middle.description: During haplotype purging, look in the middle of contigs for potential haplotigs. This removes the "-e" option from the purgedups/getseqs command.

purging_cutoffs.description: Manually override the cutoffs set by purge_dups/calcuts. Must be a comma-separated string with three coverage cutoffs - low, medium, and high - for example. "5,20,100".

polishing_options.title: Polishing options
polishing_options.description: Options for polishing genomes with 10X Illumina reads.

enable_polishing.description: Switch on to do polish purged assembly before scaffolding

polishing_assemblytypes.description: A comma-separated list defining which types of assemblies to polish. Must draw from the options "primary", "hic_phased", or "trio_binned".

polishing_longranger_container_path.description: Path to a container with longranger to use for the longranger processes. Required for polishing to run.

polishing_n_chunks_bed.description: Number of chunks to split assembly into for polishing.

hic_aligner.description: Which aligner to use to align Hi-C reads to the reference

hic_mapping_cram_chunk_size.description: Number of CRAM slices to include per CRAM file per mapping chunk. Lower values mean more Hi-C mapping jobs are spawned, but each should have a lower run time.

hic_mapping_minq.description: Minimum MapQ score for a Hi-C read to be retained for scaffolding.

enable_scaffolding.description: Enable scaffolding of assembled contigs with Hi-C.

yahs_break_contigs.description: Allow YaHS to break contigs at putative misassemblies using Hi-C data prior to scaffolding.

yahs_resolutions.description: A comma-separated list of resolutions for YaHS to examine when scaffolding.
yahs_resolutions.help_text: For highly fragmented assemblies, including higher resolutions by adding lower values to the string may improve results.

yahs_min_contig_length.description: The minimum contig length to be considered by YaHS for scaffolding.
yahs_min_contig_length.help_text: YaHS can only handle up to 45,000 contigs. If you have more, you can adjust the number of contigs going into YaHS by setting a length threshold.

cool_bin.description: Number of bins for cooler cload

assembly_qc_options.title: Assembly QC options
assembly_qc_options.description: Parameters to configure the assembly QC steps that run for each assembly generated.

busco_lineage_directory.description: Path to a local directory containing pre-downloade BUSCO lineages.
busco_lineage_directory.help_text: Lineage datasets can be downloaded using `busco --download`.

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: Base URL or local path to location of pipeline test dataset files

trace_report_suffix.description: Suffix to add to the trace report filename. Default is the date and time in the format yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss.
